The narrowing of the 5D 0 → 7F 1 line and the drop of the intensity of 5D 0 → 7F 2 transition observed in the emission spectra of BZ100 suggests a decrease of the number of spectroscopic sites determined by the simpler composition and the disappearance of the PNRs. Very similar spectra are reported for BaZrO 3 and BaSnO 3 (cubic Pm-3m) in which Eu 3+ is incorporated at the Ba site
36– 39 . Indeed, the 5D 0 → 7F 1 transition is the most intense when Eu 3+ occupies a centrosymmetric position such as O
h site of Ba in BaZrO 3 for which all transitions but 5D 0 → 7F 1 are forbidden.
